Posts.EditableText:
I think The Unknown might be referring to his personal space rather than Ryori when he says "territory". Some people are more protective than others of their personal space, and some people have a larger personal space than others.

I think it's only going to be fair if everyone starts respecting each other's boundaries. The Unknown has a particular protectiveness to his relationship with Ryori, and davidw has a particular protectiveness to his own self-importance. Other members have their own limits as to what they will accept.

This is another reason why I believe that david should be confined to an area where he really will be the centre of attention, and actually have the importance he craves. That way, I think everyone will be a lot happier, and I include david in that.

Posts.EditableText:
I disagree that there is no personal space on the internet. For example, if someone came onto a forum and started making smutty comments abot your mother, would that be okay with you? I doubt it if you have any feelings at all.

What I'm saying is that although forums exist on the internet, they are a medium by which individuals communicate on a personal level, particularly in the "chat" area, where the topics are not usually to do with games.

It is easily possible to offend somebody in a forum, and each individual has their own benchmark as to what will do that. With davidw, a challenge to his status is what brings him out fighting. With The Unknown it's the same thing, except his status is to do with his devotion to Ryori. Whilst he has used some colourful terms to announce it, at least he has made himself clear about where his limits are, something which most people never really do.

If you want to get into semantics, it could be said that The Unknown and Ryori's relationship IS their "property". The Unknown's feelings for, and exclusivity with Ryori are certainly "his".

Whilst any boyfriend of mine who called me his property could expect a swift kick in the goolies, I think the best person to judge The Unknown's attitude to Ryori is Ryori.

Lucy, yeah I'd be a little annoyed, I may even throw a tiny retort into it.
But why someone would come out and just insult random people in my life would mainly result in be telling them to bugger off, in those words, and I'd just email Alex the conversation, requesting that he'd get a PM about it.

A personal attack over the net warrents about as much feeling as spilt milk on the table top.. They're words, which amount to nothing.
Unless you've become friends with someone over the net, in which case their thoughts/feelings are important to you.

I do hope I haven't offended you Lucy, by that accusation I made in another topic.. I would like to publicly retract it, as I can't seem to find that topic. My personal opinion on that fact is beside the point, and I don't make accusations without having any facts/proof. So I'd like to apologise.
